Articles.Content: What would be the optimal height for a space station, capable of being used to build extremely large rockets in space, to have a geostationary orbit? I've already developed incredibly powerful rockets (1000+ tons, almost capable of breaking sun's gravity) without mods, but it's obviously inefficient to waste fuel on escaping Kerbin's atmosphere. So, if anyone has a good system or equation to calculate any of this, it would be greatly appreciated.

2,868,000 meters above the surface, as that's the only height geostationary can be at. I think you mean something else.

Now I would put it low as you would save fuel, like 75,000-100,000 meter orbits, and they are also easy to meet up with.
